fields.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description: A simple but timeless cookie recipe.

fields.title: Summer Salad
fields.description: A healthy and fruity salad with lots of protein.

fields.title: Butter Chicken
fields.description: A rich but healthy take on the classic dish.

fields.title: Carrot Cake
fields.description: A moist and flavorful cake. A perfect snack with afternoon tea.

fields.title: Healthy Blueberry Muffins
fields.description: A healthy but still tasty snack.

fields.description: A classic dish from the Emilia Romagna region of Italy.

fields.title: Homemade Pizza
fields.description: A fun and tasty dinner option.

fields.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a small mixing bowl, beat butter until light and fluffy. About 2 minutes.
Add both sugars to the creamed butter and beat on high speed for 3 minutes.
Add the eggs to the butter mixture, one at a time, beating the mixture in between each addition.
Add the vanilla extract to the wet mixture.
Gently fold the wet mixture into the flour.
Mix in the chocolate chips.
Using a spoon, portion out 12 cookies onto a baking tray, leaving enough room in between.
Bake the cookies for 8-12 minutes, until golden brown.
Mash avocados in a medium bowl, add lemon juice and salt.
Bring water to a boil in a small sauce pan, add the vinegar.
Swirl the boiling water with a spoon, and gently add the eggs one at a time.
Remove the eggs with a slotted spoon after 3 minutes.
Spread the avocado on the bread and garnish with arugula, onion, feta, and red pepper flakes
Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
In a small mixing bowl, beat eggs, yogurt, apple sauce, vanilla, and sugar.
In a medium mixing bowl sift together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Zest lemons using a fine grater and add to flour mixture.
Combine wet and dry mixtures, folding gently with a spatula.
Fold in blueberries after washing.
Grease muffin pan with butter.
Using a large spoon, portion out muffins, filling about two thirds of the way.
Sprinkle with coarse sugar and bake for 20 minutes.
Finely dice onion.
Heat oil in a large pan.
Saute onions until tender, add spice mixture and cook for another minute or two.
Add chicken breasts and cook thoroughly.
Add tomato paste and tomato puree, simmer for 10 minutes.
Add heavy cream and continue cooking for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve warm over rice or with naan bread.
Mince one clove of garlic, and saute in olive oil on medium heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook for 10-15 minutes. Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Chop cooked chicken, strawberries, avocado, almonds, and feta.
In a small bowl, combine remaining olive oil, balsamic vinegar and one clove of garlic to make the dressing.
Wash arugula, and place in a large salad bowl.
Top salad with the other ingredients and dressing
Toss and serve
Pour water into mixing bowl
Add harina P.A.N. and salt to water and mix until a nice dough is formed.
Take dough and form in shape of small disks. If dough does not keep form, add more harina P.A.N.
Heat stove on high and place disk shaped dough into frying pan. Fry both sides of dough for 5 minutes each.
Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease two medium cake tins with flour and butter.
In a medium bowl, cream butter and sugar, add other wet ingredients one at a time, mixing well in between.
Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Gently fold wet mixture into dry ingredients.
Add grated carrots and lemon zest.
Pour batter into greased cake tins and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Finely dice carrots and onions.
Heat the olive oil in a large pot on medium heat.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add the carrots and onions to the hot pan and saute until tender.
Add the ground beef and panchetta and cook thoroughly
Season with oregano, thyme, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add red wine and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Boil tagliatelle for 5-10 minutes.
Serve with grated parmigiano reggiano and fresh basil.
Preheat oven to 450F.
Cut tomatoes into halves or quarters.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Put tomatoes on the pan and season with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil.
Roast tomatoes for 40 minutes, turning half way through.
After allowing tomatoes to cool, blend and add cream, pesto, and seasoning.
Simmer blended soup in a large pot for 10-20 minutes.
Serve warm with a dollop of cream and lots of bread.
In a small bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and sugar. Wait 20 minutes for yeast to activate.
Gently need yeast mixture into flour to form dough. Add extra flour as needed to form a moist but workable dough.
Allow the dough to rest for 1-2hours in a damp, warm area.
Portion dough into individual pizzas and form pizza shape. Allow dough to rest for 20 minutes.
Spread sauce on pizzas and sprinkle cheese and basil over the pizza.
(Optional) Add other toppings
Bake for 25-35 minutes at 400F.
Preheat oven to 315F.
In a large mixing bowl beat cream cheese on high speed for 2 minutes.
Add sugar, eggs, vanilla, lemon zest, baking soda, flour, and salt.
Crush gingersnaps and combine with butter.
Line the bottom of the springform pan with the crushed cookie mixture.
Bake crust for 5 minutes.
Line springform with aluminum foil
Pour cheesecake batter over pre-baked crust and bake for 50 minutes in a water bath.
Allow cheesecake to cool overnight.
Cut lemon into slices
Heat equal parts sugar and water in a small pot, add lemons
Cook until a lemon infused simple syrup has been made.
Pour syrup over cooled cheesecake and serve cold.
